column4: hey guys, EXTREME Ubuntu n00b here.....how the heck does one upgrade FF in Ubuntu.  I DL'ed the 3.5 file, but this is so different from Vista, im lost!
so, i should stick with what i have then?
you want firefox 3.5, right?
and, compared to Vista, this is INCREDIBLY slow.  Any ideas?
which is?
okay, i dont see that listed in my add-ons
if by "which is?" you mean what is gnash, it is a reverse engineered open source/free software implementation of adobe flash player.
thanks for the explanation
where is that.....ive been running Ubuntu for litereally 10 mins
hit alt+f2 on your keyboard, and then type "gnome-system-monitor" (without the quotes)
yessir
was just fixing to reply
system monitor is up
nothing like that is listed
yes
the live cd
havent done a complete install yet, as i was unsure about what i was getting into
i apologize for not saying that right off the bat then

if you're using a 9.04 live CD, you should probably go ahead and do the install before you try to upgrade firefox to 3.5, if that's what you're looking to do. otherwise, the new firefox won't be saved to your installed apps next time you run the cd.
i mainly just wanted to explore, and play with this OS before i committed to it 100%
so far, its not that bad, IMO
isnit possible to do a install to HDD, and NOT lose my vista.  For reverting purposes?
what is a Wubi?

yes, wubi will do that, or, should you choose to actually istall ubuntu from the live cd,in most cases, ubuntu's installer will automatically set up a dual-boot for you, provided that you do not try to install ubuntu on the same partition as your vista install
